value: hello everybody I am going to continue
on in the theme of the scapegoat because
I believe this is kind of one of the
hearts of the matter maybe the heart of
the matter is a group projection of all
of their negative qualities and all of
their garbage and all of their mistakes
and all of their failings onto one
target the scapegoat the black sheep the
fall guy the bad guy the villain and
this applies in families and it applies
in workplaces and it applies in
marriages and it applies in politics
it applies nationally in communities it
is a phenomenon at the heart of the
matter and at the heart of the heart of
the matter is fear as always many wise
people have said that the choice in life
always is the choice between fear and
love and I believe that is true today on
the theme of the scapegoat I want to
look at the making of the scapegoat and
a lot of what goes in to making the
scapegoat is the pulling of the wool
over other people's eyes I've seen time
and again and heard time and again from
other scapegoats that the most painful
part of it all is having the people
around you not believe you not see it
from your point of view and turn their
backs on you and when they do that they
are joining in the effort of making you
the scapegoat they are keeping you there
and that is
that is something that goes right to the
heart of a person's being and the urge
when that happens is to continue to
defend yourself to continue to tell your
side of the story and I get that I've
done that I did that all my life until
recently because what I've realized is I
can't make anyone choose love over fear
and I certainly can't talk them out of
one to the one of the underlying
psychologies of how they enable the the
process that creates scapegoats I can't
talk them out of that they have to do
that themselves as painful as it is for
me personally to know about the lies and
know about the projection and know about
the twisted facts it is extremely
painful and I share your pain in going
through it but there's a trap there if
you try to defend yourself to
vociferously the thing is that it plays
right into the hands of the people who
make you the scapegoat it's like they
already thought of it it's like your
defense is built in to their offense
it's part of it like the fish caught in
the net the harder you struggle the more
entangled you become and today I want to
tell a personal story that illustrates
what happens if you don't struggle and
this is a story from my past again it's
amazing what looking inward and
reflecting can do because this is
something from 25 years ago
well not quite that long
22 years ago I again I'm seeing things
more clearly now I'm getting to put new
words to them as I learn new words and
as I grow as a as a person
my journey lengthens and I am I'm
getting to know me getting to know the
world through different eyes and I see
this past experience now even though it
was very significant for me at the time
this was a very significant moment for
me back then but now I really see how
this can inform me today so before I
tell the story I want to reiterate that
this is for all of you scapegoats who
are feeling that searing pain and in
fact as I'm talking about it right now
I feel that hole in my heart that
burning between my breasts that almost
nauseas feeling that you get when
there's an injustice in front of you
that you really can't do anything about
you are relying on other people to do
the right thing and you can't help them
get there all you can do is sit and be
and wait this story is for you guys
because this story is about a time when
I didn't even know this was happening
and how it all shook out in the end and
the only reason I know it now is because
someone was very courageous and they
told me after a lot of time had passed
so indulge me for the next 10 minutes
while I tell the story
the story when I was 22 I got pregnant
and I wasn't married but my daughter's
father who I'm going to call Stuart he
and I stayed together and we raised the
baby for a little while the baby had
colic and she cried from the time she
was about 10 weeks old until the time
she was about 15 weeks old anybody who's
been through this knows that this is an
incredibly stressful experience and it's
not even describable unless you've been
there and naturally because we were
young we Stuart and I ended up arguing
quite a bit during this period and also
during this period I was not working and
he was earning our money through a job
as a waiter at a restaurant a young
couple we did not have much his hours
were very unpredictable and long and I
was left alone in the house with this
child who was inconsolable and I became
somewhat inconsolable there is no doubt
that I was difficult and the baby was
difficult and Stuart having to work and
come home to that was under a lot of
pressure so I want to say that however
one of the nights of the colicky crying
we were both up it was five o'clock in
the morning and I don't remember what it
was but we were standing at the fridge I
remember that much we were standing at
the fridge and an argument broke out and
he left and he never came back he took
our car and we lived in a place where it
wasn't easy for me to get out
so a couple of days passed and I started
to panic of course because I had no
money of my own coming in small savings
and I had no vehicle and I hadn't had
any contact from Stewart at all so I
phoned his workplace and I knew right
from the start that this was not going
to be cool it's not cool to phone
someone's work looking for them and I
felt humiliated also that I was going to
have to say is he still working there is
he there now yes I'm his the mother of
his child and yes he was living with us
and yes he has abandoned us and I didn't
want to do that I didn't want to put
myself in that position but it was the
only place I knew to look for him and I
was really surprised when I phoned I
could hear it in their voice I was an
enemy they had been warned that this
might happen and they treated me that
way and I felt kicked in the stomach my
urge was to tell them the whole story
but what I was helpless I didn't know
them he had known them for a long period
of time and I didn't know them very well
I didn't know what he had said to them
already
and I felt pathetic I felt pathetic
anyway but so I got off the phone but
days passed after that phone call and
still nothing from Stewart still nothing
so I went to his workplace as tail
tucked between my legs and humiliated as
I was to show up there I was feeling so
desperate
I was literally abandoned and I went
there and now I just got the same
treatment but in person face to face
and I knew there was nothing I could say
what could I say
he had already set the stage he had
already pulled the wool over their eyes
so I was I knew there was no use I tried
to say listen please understand I have
no money I don't know what he's doing no
matter what he has said I can promise
you that that nothing outstanding
happened here were to human beings and
he has a baby and I I'm desperate but
they didn't want to be involved
obviously so showing up at his work to
find him played right into his hands it
reinforced the story that he must have
told which was that he had no choice but
to leave me
I was unstable I was unpredictable it
was too much so when a teary-eyed
desperate woman shows up at a workplace
asking to see someone who has already
told the story that look out she might
come and try to tell you her sob story
look out there I was doing that there I
was doing that proving his lie to be
correct
it is a trap
but I see the conundrum and that's why
I'm making this audio recording today
because I know you are stuck between a
rock and a hard place it's a no-win
situation and I think I have said in
multiple videos I hate being in no-win
situations who doesn't lose lose the
universe is saying you lose this one you
just lose this one
it stinks so I went home and eventually
Stuart did call and it was nothing that
you wouldn't expect
he was never intending to come back I
was on my own
goodbye and so I put my life back
together and a year or a year and a half
past and I was living in a new place and
I had an income again and I had some
breathing room I had picked myself back
up from that incident and I I was in a
good state and I went and I tried out
for a local theatre production and I got
a part
I knew the director and one of the quote
stars of the show but I didn't know
anybody else involved in in the
production at all and we rehearsed and
were together quite a lot it's an
intense bonding experience when you're
in a theatrical production and this one
in particular it was a strange play with
sword fighting and some some sexuality
involved and so you do intensely bond
with the people involved and about a
month and a half into it the stage
manager a woman about my age so we were
about 25 24 25 years old
she she and I had interacted a lot and
she was pleasant and and she she came up
to me one day in the dressing room and
she said you know I know Stuart from
before and my heart kind of draw
because I wasn't expecting his name to
be brought up in this environment and
also I thought oh I know Stewart said
you know clearly Stewart has portrayed
me as some kind of raving lunatic
undercover maniac because how else could
they have taken his side he was clearly
wrong he clearly abandoned his wife
quote-unquote and new baby he clearly
did that everybody knew he did that and
so the reason he must have given for
doing that must have been pretty good so
she knew Stewart before and what must
she think of me and this could have gone
one of two ways you know you process
things really fast in your head when
someone hits you with that sort of
unexpected announcement you're like oh
my goodness okay either she's going to
say so you don't fool me bitch or she's
going to say something nice or she might
be about to tell me a secret
I didn't know so I just waited I was
scared
quite honestly she said you are nothing
like what he said you were and I relaxed
but I was still curious all these months
year and a half had passed I wondered I
always had wondered what did he say to
justify his actions at that time which
were so evidently wrong what did he say
but she didn't tell me and I didn't ask
because that just would have hurt me but
what she did say was I misjudged you I
judged you based on his rumors and his
lies I see now because we had been
working together for a month and a half
at this point in an intense intimate
environment where tempers do flare and
emotions are right there on the surface
that's how you put together a production
and it requires a combination of
discipline and freedom
to really put that a good production
together so I guess she figured she had
had a chance now to see how I responded
to different stresses and what she told
me
really was that her her preconceptions
of me were based on nothing when she
reflected back on it they were based on
the word of a man she trusted for
whatever reason he is charming he is
funny he comes across as well-read and
smart and he dresses well and he's tall
and he was well-built and he's ready
with a smile that's why I fell for him
that's why I fell for him but what I
noticed about him and I still notice to
this day because Stuart and I have a
good relationship and always have with
the occasional blow-up as it is when you
try to co-parent a child from two
separate families but we I would be
willing to bet that if we were if you
asked him separately now today after
we've both matured he would admit that
it's been a nice co-parenting
relationship but what I noticed about
Stuart after the charm had worn off was
that he did everything he could to
impress the people who didn't quite know
him yet and I was put last on the list
because he'd already done his work with
me he'd already impressed me he already
had me I already had his baby I was
already living in his house he didn't
need to impress me anymore and believe
me he didn't try and what this stage
manager was letting me know in that
moment was that she was wrong to make
that judgment based on nothing really I
was so
my load was so lightened by that that
there are people who can be mature
enough to reflect and to wait and to
withhold and to give someone a second
chance she could have gone off for her
first impressions of her mistaken
impression not a first impression a
mistaken impression of me she could have
and I'm sure if she did that whole
production would have felt the nastiness
of that but she didn't do that and I
thank her for that and I also thank her
for her courage because I never would
have known ever I never would have known
that she even knew Stewart let alone had
had formed these early impressions of me
based on what he said I never would have
known that and she brought it up
voluntarily and she admitted her
shortcoming voluntarily and that's
really impressive to me so all of you
scapegoats all of you who have been
smeared I am NOT going to say that it
isn't excruciating it is totally
excruciating but what I am saying by
this story is I'm trying to get to the
idea that maybe maybe it's better to
pretend you don't even know it's
happening
in some ways because in this case with
the story I just told you I didn't I
mean I knew Stewart was off there
slandering me but I didn't know any of
the people and then when I came into
contact with one of the people I didn't
know she was one of them I didn't know
her background and so I didn't feel any
need to defend myself or act any
differently in front of her when I first
met her which was a blessing and a gift
because thank what would how might that
have been different if I did know she
was under these false impressions maybe
I would have wanted to defend myself or
act extra sweet towards her and maybe
that would have put her hackles up maybe
she would have been on
bird and defensive and and thought yeah
I can see the the dishonesty in this
woman I can see the duplicity I can see
that she has a need to cover something
up but I didn't know and that was a
blessing because I could just be myself
and she could judge for herself and she
did and it worked out so fellow
scapegoats
try not to explain yourself because from
my personal experience that is a trap it
is part of the offense is making you
defend yourself and then using your
defense against you carry yourself the
way you are most proud of yourself
and honestly and this is so hard to do
let the chips fall where they may
I promise you that the right people the
right people will see sometimes you
can't identify who those people are at
all sometimes they come out of the
woodwork sometimes they are the least
expected and sometimes the person you
expect to see the truth doesn't and
never will it's just one of life's
rollercoaster gut-wrenching hold on to
